title: Madita
text:
Edita Malovčić (born 21 January 1978), known by her <a href="stage%20name">stage name</a> Madita, is an <a href="Austria">Austria</a>n singer and actress of <a href="Bosnians">Bosnian</a> descent. Her father is Bosnian folk singer <a href="Kemal%20Malov%C4%8Di%C4%87">Kemal Malovčić</a>. Madita's music ranges from <a href="synth-pop">synthpop</a> to <a href="Contemporary%20R%26amp%3BB">R&B</a> to <a href="jazz">jazz</a>.
Early life.
Born Edita Malovčić in <a href="Vienna">Vienna</a>, the daughter of <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnian</a> folk singer
<a href="Kemal%20Malov%C4%8Di%C4%87">Kemal Malovčić</a> from his first marriage to a Serbian woman. Madita has stated that she has not been in contact with her father for many years and that she has "no good memories" of him.
Career.
Acting career.
She studied <a href="musicology">musicology</a> and took private acting-lessons. In 1999 she acted in the Austrian film "<a href="Nordrand">Nordrand</a>", which won many awards. The film's subject was the <a href="Bosnian%20War">Bosnian War</a>. After her first success she played in many films, such as "Berlin Is In Germany" (2001), "Kaltfront" (2003), "<a href="%C5%BDelary">Želary</a>" (2003) and "Vier Minuten" (2006). And she also played characters in TV series "<a href="SOKO%20Kitzb%C3%BChel">SOKO Kitzbühel</a>", "<a href="Inspector%20Rex">Inspector Rex</a>" and "<a href="Medicopter%20117%20%E2%80%93%20Jedes%20Leben%20z%C3%A4hlt">Medicopter 117</a>".
Music career.
The first time she acted as a singer was in 2002, when she sang for the duo <a href="dZihan%20%26amp%3B%20Kamien">dZihan & Kamien</a> and their album <a href="Gran%20Riserva">Gran Riserva</a>. Her first solo album <a href="Madita%20%28album%29">Madita</a> was released in 2005. In December 2005 the album was also released on the <a href="iTunes%20Music%20Store">iTunes Music Store</a>, where she reached the top 3 of the "Electronic Album Chart". Months later she also reached many charts in other countries. Her biggest "download success" was reaching number 1 in the UK World Music iTunes chart. In 2007, the song "Ceylon" from this album was featured on an episode of <a href="Damages%20%28TV%20series%29">Damages</a>.
In 2008 she released her second album "<a href="Too%20%28Madita%20album%29">Too</a>" in Austria. In the US the album was released on March 28, 2008, it is also available on the iTunes Store. Two years later, Madita released "Flavours", a nine track album with five previously unreleased tracks, and four remixed tracks. The album has a total run-time of 50 minutes and was released under Gran Depot Music label. The album was also part of a larger collection, titled "Madita Deluxe" which featured a large collection of most of Madita's previous and new songs.
Personal life.
Madita has a son (born ).
